meanings.sent1: The phone was easily callable when it rang.
meanings.sent2: The bell was a callable signal for the students to line up.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the toy mouse very callable and chased it around.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a callable melody that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a picnic on a sunny day was so callable that everyone agreed to go.

meanings.sent1: The lost dog had a callable tag with the owner's contact information.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's performance was so impressive that a callable offer came from a top team.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten password was surprisingly callable after a few attempts.
meanings.sent4: His memory of the childhood home was like a callable dream that he could revisit.
meanings.sent5: The scent of freshly baked cookies was so callable that it brought back memories of grandma's kitchen.

meanings.definition: Subject to being called in for redemption
meanings.sent1: The bond was callable after the specified period for full repayment.
meanings.sent2: The coupon was a callable incentive for customers to return to the store.
meanings.sent3: The library book, long overdue, was finally callable for return.
meanings.sent4: His promise to help was like a callable favor that she could ask for anytime.
meanings.sent5: The opportunity to travel was so callable that she couldn't resist booking the tickets.
